action.action-desc: Mr. Capuano (for himself and Mr. Stivers) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To amend the Volcker Rule to permit certain investment advisers to share a similar name with a private equity fund, subject to certain restrictions, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Investor Clarity and Bank Parity Act.
Section 13 of the Bank Holding Company Act of 1956 (12 U.S.C. 1851) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (d)(1)(G)(vi), by inserting before the semicolon the following:

quoted-block.text: , except that the hedge fund or private equity fund may share the same name or a variation of the same name as a banking entity that is an investment adviser to the hedge fund or private equity find, if—

subclause.text: such investment adviser is not an insured depository institution, a company that controls an insured depository institution, or a company that is treated as a bank holding company for purposes of section 8 of the International Banking Act of 1978;

such investment adviser does not share the same name or a variation of the same name as an insured depository institution, any company that controls an insured depository institution, or any company that is treated as a bank holding company for purposes of section 8 of the International Banking Act of 1978; and
such name does not contain the word bank

paragraph.text: in subsection (h)(5)(C), by inserting before the period the following: , except as permitted under subsection (d)(1)(G)(vi).
